channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Bricks lifted as tree roots extended and grown underneath, 19th September
item.description:
The bricks have lifted and health and safety risk to all pedestrians

item.title: Fly tipping, 19th September
item.description:
When i go down wallhouse Rd and Burnett Rd to alsford timber, you see how much flytiping there is even though there are singes about flytiping, it is getting dangerous when travelling by car as the rubbish is starting to block the road, it's a shame as it's getting in the stream as well each side of the road.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Slade Green, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: On stairs at top of Belsize Road leading to Finchley Road, 19th September
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swiss Terrace, Belsize Park, London

item.title: 4 smelly house bins have been dumped, 19th September
item.description:
4 bins broken smelly have been dumped next to our communal bins for over a year and still there ,people from the houses on knightland rd have been dumping them and have been seen,and told hackney council need come take them away there's is lots off flys he
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Warwick Grove, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Communal areas are very dirty, 19th September
item.description:
The lifts and staircase are unusable due to trash and stench. In the lift there is trash water all over the floor, and on the stairs there's pools of urine along with trash. The corridors are also littered with trash.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brenthouse Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lots of overflowing lidless bins, 19th September
item.description:
Lots of lidless bins overflowing with rubbish, which are never emptied. The address is 100 Lee High Road. The bins need to be removed, as they form a blockage on the pavement. Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lee High Road, Hither Green, London

item.title: Bins from HMO, 19th September
item.description:
These bins which are sitting on the pavement and have now been here for 3 weeks originate from the HMO which also has a front garden full of waste which is all in the wrong bins. I have reported these before and yet nothing is done. Furthermore your own Bin men claim that they can’t remove because it’s all contaminated waste. If no one from the council can or will move this rubbish how are we supposed to keep Vanbrugh Park clean . It’s toxic and it needs removing. Not only that it’s a hazard for blind and disabled people.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 61, Vanbrugh Park, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped on grass verge and pavement including mattress on crossways the pavement between pointer close and watersmeet way, 19th September
item.description:
This area is regularly used as a rubbish dump and rubbish is currently strewn along this stretch or road. It would be helpful if the council checked regularly and maybe installed cameras in an attempt to discourage this. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crossway, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Flag on Lampost opposite Elmer’s End roundabout, 19th September
item.description:
There are two Union Jack flags that have been illegally put up on a lamp post outside Elmers end roundabout. Under the highway act 1980 it is illegal to attach anything to public infrastructure as such I would urge you to take action and immediately remove the flags in accordance with the law.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet
